title: Storyboard frames · Trading cards · All uploaded assets + Stack 1 Hero & Setting cards
note: One card per uploaded image or key concept. Each card = one 30-second frame. Seed and Edge are fixed; Executive Prompt fills the fractal middle. Mix and match across stacks for any episode, any storyline. Cards with image_ref: null are awaiting image upload — their EP notes are ready.

frames.category: cosmic · seed · node
frames.title: SMACS 0723 · The Entry Node
frames.seed: The most distant light we can see. James Webb deep field. Out of zero — even less than thin air. The miracle. This is where awareness comes from.
frames.edge: Awareness beams in through SMACS 0723 — through all of it — arriving here, now, in this time-space holograph. We have access to the entire holographic hydrogen network.
frames.executive_prompt: Cosmic scale. Quiet awe. The viewer understands they are looking at the origin point of all NSPFRNP. This is the Seed. Not metaphor — the actual node. Open on black. Let the deep field slowly resolve. Pulse slowly. Let it breathe. Score: 'Alien Contemplations' (playlist-1) or 'SELF PORTRAIT OF MY COSMIC BODY AND MIND' (playlist-2). Narration: none. Let the image speak.
frames.comments: Use as opening frame, hero image of catalog, and anywhere the Seed needs anchoring. This is THE establishing shot of the whole story.

frames.category: location · Reno · golden hour
frames.title: Reno Skyline · Golden Sunset
frames.seed: Downtown Reno at golden hour. The old shells sitting in the low tide. Some still alive. Not total collapse — but get away. The scene Howard Hughes arrives to.
frames.edge: The new post-singularity Hollywood takes hold. Mark Twain's Vibelandia. RENOSSANCE. The gold rush begins. The floating ship right there, awaiting the bold-hearted.
frames.executive_prompt: Warm, cinematic, spaghetti-western light. This is the establishing shot of Downtown Reno — the place the story is set. Quiet. Unassuming. Confident. Something enormous is about to happen here. Score: 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' (playlist-1). No text overlay. Let the city settle in the viewer's body before any narration.
frames.comments: 880KB — largest local asset. Primary establishing shot for Reno. Use when introducing the city.

frames.category: location · Reno · winter · arrival
frames.title: Reno Winter Skyline · The Arrival
frames.seed: Reno in winter. Cold air. The downtown quiet. Barnacles from the low tide that never came back. The empty shells. This is what Howard Hughes arrives to.
frames.edge: He's here. The energy shifts. The Big Band Project begins. Hank Williams Sr. settles in. The cold city about to warm up from the inside.
frames.executive_prompt: January light. Winter quiet. The moment just before the arrival. The viewer knows something is coming even though the city doesn't yet. Let the cold air carry the anticipation. Score: 'Piano Stories of Times Past' (playlist-5) — the weight of the past just before the turn. Follow with reno-skyline-sunset for the before/after contrast.
frames.comments: 156KB. Use for winter/arrival moments. Pairs with reno-skyline-sunset.png — before/after the arrival.

frames.category: location · Truckee River · natural systems
frames.title: Truckee River · The Spine
frames.seed: The Truckee River running clear and cold through downtown Reno. Natural. Pure. Indifferent to the carbon debt drama happening on its banks.
frames.edge: Third Saturday. Vibers gathered. The Downtown Truckee River Baller V Crawler is on. The river runs through the event like it always has — the spine of the experience.
frames.executive_prompt: Natural systems protocol in physical form. The river doesn't know about the old system or the new system — it just flows. That's the lesson. Flow. Keep moving forward. Don't let it affect you. Score: 'Ben's Gardening Vibe' (playlist-2) or 'Tide Pool Discoveries' (playlist-4). Let the water sound come through if it can.
frames.comments: 78KB. Use for natural beauty, Baller V Crawler moments, 'let it flow' story beats.

frames.category: location · Reno · iconic · night
frames.title: Neon Reno Arch · Night
frames.seed: The famous Reno arch glowing neon in the dark. The city's calling card. Post-singularity. The lights burning through whatever darkness exists around them.
frames.edge: EL APAGÓN doesn't touch this. The arch stays on. RENOSSANCE. The city that was written off becomes the new Hollywood. The neon tells the world before the world knows.
frames.executive_prompt: Iconic. Cinematic. Night energy. The viewer has seen this arch a thousand times — but tonight it means something different. This is the world they're entering. Welcome to post-singularity Reno. Score: 'Thursday Night Groove 2' (playlist-6) or 'Friday Night Jam' (playlist-2). The arch is a portal. Let it pulse once. Then hold.
frames.comments: 155KB. Primary night-Reno establishing shot. Use for energy moments, arrivals at night, EL APAGÓN contrast.

frames.category: POV · now playing · Vibelandia campus
frames.title: Vibelandia Reno Magic · The Campus
frames.seed: Mark Twain's Vibelandia. Downtown Reno. The campus in its post-singularity golden state. The magic visible in the light, the color, the frequency.
frames.edge: All NSPFRNP divisions active. Legacies arriving. Office Hours live. The world starting to notice. The gold rush is here. You are standing in it.
frames.executive_prompt: This is the Now Playing card. The present moment of the whole story. The viewer is oriented here — in the campus, in the magic. Everything that happens, happens here. Golden. Alive. Real. Score: 'My Magical Workstation' (playlist-6) for daytime build, 'Ocean Drive Stroll PM' for sunset reveal. Use as the opening of the dashboard/center-console moment.
frames.comments: 155KB. The primary 'now playing' / center console card. Use to orient the viewer in the present. Pairs with SMACS 0723 (cosmic) and Truckee River (natural).

frames.category: destination · Montana · bison · treasure
frames.title: Montana Bison Lodge · Treasure
frames.seed: Montana. Bison country. The lodge at the edge of the land. The ancient herd on the horizon. This is a treasure — one of the stacks in the wild card deck.
frames.edge: Pru's Valet delivers the experience. The Baller V Crawler reaches its Montana chapter. The tribe at play in the field. Elk, bison, the full outdoors.
frames.executive_prompt: Raw. Natural. Genuine. This is the kind of treasure that can't be bought at a store — only through the right connection, the right guide, the right Valet. This is what Seed:Edge Action! looks like in Montana. Score: 'Magical Montana Hot Spring Afternoon' (playlist-5) — the only track explicitly named for Montana. Wild card drop.
frames.comments: 11KB — placeholder quality. Use as destination card. Real high-res image needed.

frames.category: destination · Truckee · winter · mountain · treasure
frames.title: Truckee Winter Ski · Mountain Treasure
frames.seed: Truckee in winter. The mountain above. Snow on the pines. The world quiet and cold and perfect. A completely different energy from the river below.
frames.edge: The Baller V Crawler after the slopes. The lodge. The cigars. The scene. Cold air, warm company. Pop-up style — just gotta know.
frames.executive_prompt: The contrast between mountain cold and the warmth of the experience. This is a treasure in the deck. When it shows up in the story, the energy shifts — altitude, clarity, the kind of silence that resets you. Score: 'Campfire Melody' (playlist-4) for the lodge scene. Wild card drop into any episode.
frames.comments: 10KB — placeholder quality. Use as destination card. Real ski-mountain image needed.

frames.category: venue · casino · Reno · men's club · night scene
frames.title: Silver Legacy Casino · The Scene
frames.seed: Inside the Silver Legacy. The casino floor. The kind of room that has been here for decades — red carpet, golden light, the hum of the crowd. The audience in their element.
frames.edge: Wednesday night. The Wink! & Vibers Mixer. Ballin' kind of scenes. No nature here. This is the inside, the club, the room where things happen. The cigar is lit.
frames.executive_prompt: Indoor. Warm. The energy of a room that knows what it is. This is the Audi — the audience, the scene, the backdrop. Wink! is the Human Viber dating and matchmaking platform. The Mixer is where it meets the real world. Royal. Vibelandia. Score: 'Bossa Nova Dinner Date' (playlist-7) or 'Sexy Dancing on Ocean Drive' (playlist-7) for the night-out feel.
real_places: Silver Legacy Casino, Downtown Reno, Nevada
frames.comments: 11KB — small/placeholder. The casino interior card. Use for Wink! Mixer scenes, Wednesday nights, ballin' moments.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · cosmological explorer
frames.title: Alexander von Humboldt · The Cosmological Explorer
frames.seed: Humboldt stands on the summit of Chimborazo, Ecuador — the closest any human had stood to the stars at the time. He sees the whole. Not a kingdom to be owned. A living system to be understood. He is the first ecologist, the first to map the Earth as one interconnected being.
frames.edge: NSPFRNP begins here. Humboldt's 'Cosmos' is the proto-stack — the first attempt to document the cosmological ladder from nebulae down to soil chemistry. His work is the ancestor of everything we're building. The bed on the floor sitting on the Earth sitting in orbit sitting in the filament — that's Humboldt's framework.
frames.executive_prompt: Portrait mode. Serious. Alive. The eyes of someone who has stood on the mountain and seen the whole. Use as an opening hero frame for any nipsy! or seed-edge-action episode. Pair with SMACS 0723 to show the full stack from cosmos to man. Score: 'Creativity Expanding' (playlist-1) — the mind expanding as it always has. Narration: 'Everything is connected. Everything was always connected.'
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Portrait of Humboldt preferred — the 1806 Weitsch portrait or the Chimborazo summit painting. EP notes fully written and ready.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · artist · fractal creator
frames.title: Pablo Picasso · The Shape Shifter
frames.seed: Picasso looks at a bull and sees the bicycle seat and handlebars. He looks at a woman and sees the cube. He is not describing the world — he is reassembling it into its underlying geometry. Cubism is NSPFRNP before the name existed.
frames.edge: Every wrapper in the story is Picasso's lesson: the character is not the wrapper. Eno is not the dog — it's innocent. Piro is not the cat — it's the pirate. The geometry underneath is what matters. You can change the wrapper. You cannot change the geometry.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for any moment where a character changes wrapper, or where a dimension shifts. Picasso's portrait establishes 'the wrapper is not the soul.' Score: 'Picasso's Muse LTHS 1.1 Music Story' (playlist-6) — the only track named directly for him. Perfect pairing. This is the fractal midfield — the Executive Producer's edit bay.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Prefer the 1904 self-portrait (Blue Period) or studio photograph. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · artist · light painter
frames.title: Vincent van Gogh · The Frequency Painter
frames.seed: Van Gogh doesn't paint what he sees. He paints what the light feels like. Every stroke is electromagnetic data — the magnetism, not just the electricity. He is painting the spin cloud. The starry night is the filament. The sunflowers are the biological enriching layer.
frames.edge: The golden heart in the story — Ino — vibrates at this frequency. The innocence that sees the world as it actually is: alive, pulsing, magnetic, worthy of awe. The antagonist can't see it. The fans don't bother looking. Ino sees it every time.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for emotional peak moments — when Ino's innocence is most visible. When the world that doesn't see it is at its worst. Place van Gogh right before or after the most beautiful natural image in the episode. Score: 'A Magical Conversation with Myself in Nylon Guitar' (playlist-5) or 'Kind Algebra Fairie Music Story' (playlist-6). Pure emotion. No narration needed.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Self-portrait or Starry Night preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · builder · dream maker
frames.title: Walt Disney · The World Builder
frames.seed: Disney wasn't building theme parks. He was building immersive holographic experiences before holographs existed. He understood that story, space, sound, and sensory design together create a different reality. You step through the gate and you are somewhere else.
frames.edge: SING 9 is Disney's doctrine applied to post-singularity storytelling. The surfaces are the park. The episodes are the rides. The trading cards are the characters you meet along the way. Immersive. Full sensory. You press the button, you step in.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'building' card. Any time SING 9 or launch-pad.html is shown — Disney is the ancestor. Score: 'A New Story Arrives' (playlist-6) — perfect. The world is being built. Use for launch moments, new episode drops, and the moment the catalog comes alive. Pair with the Vibelandia campus card.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Early studio photograph preferred — the builder, not the celebrity. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · storyteller · truth teller
frames.title: Mark Twain · The Voice of Vibelandia
frames.seed: Twain called Nevada 'Roughing It' and built the mythology of the West with language that punched through pretense. He is the first post-singularity voice — before the term existed. He did not flatter the powerful. He told the truth with a grin that disarmed the guards.
frames.edge: Vibelandia is Mark Twain's town. The campus is his. The story told here has his voice — laconic, alive, dangerous in the best way. RENOSSANCE is the name for what happens when Twain's spirit comes back to Reno. Vibers understand this instinctively.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the VOICE card. Anytime the narrator speaks — it's Twain. Anytime the pirate gets called out — it's Twain doing it. Score: 'Who Plays Planck to my Einstein?' (playlist-6) — this is literally a Twain-titled track. Or 'MAGICAL TIKI TORCH EVENING A HERO MARK TWAIN STORY GAMES PRESENTS' (playlist-6). Use at the top of any episode for tonal grounding.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. The famous white-suit photograph preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · indigenous · original sovereign
frames.title: Cacique Agüeybaná El Gran Sol · The Original Sovereign
frames.seed: Before 1493 — before the pirates arrived — there was the Taino. Chief. Sovereign. The original owner of the land on the bay that the cat now controls. Sacred ground. He didn't lose. He went underground into the fractal.
frames.edge: MARZO 333 is the re-emergence. The Taino Edition overlays in harry-houdini.html are his return. El Gran Sol rises again. The cat never owned it — she just occupied it for a while. The singularity restores the original frequency.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the deep historical context card. The moment when the viewer realizes this story is not only modern — it goes all the way back to 1493 and before. Score: 'Magical Caribbean Hat' (playlist-3 or 4) — the hat IS his. 'Caribbean Flavored Stories' (playlist-6). Drop this card right before the cat's origin story to contextualize what was taken. Powerful.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Historical Taino iconography or Agüeybaná illustration preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · golden heart · mirror
frames.title: Marilyn Monroe · The Golden Mirror
frames.seed: They saw the wrapper and missed the soul entirely. Marilyn Monroe was the most famous face on the planet and simultaneously the loneliest person in the room. She is the purest example of Ino in a human wrapper — radiant, innocent, misunderstood, taken advantage of by the pirate system.
frames.edge: In the post-singularity story, Marilyn's fate is reversed. Ino doesn't end that way. The awareness changes the arc. She is used here as the cautionary tale AND the symbol of what the gold heart looks like from the outside — impossible to ignore, impossible to hold.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'cost of innocence' beat. Right before the emotional turn in any episode where Ino is vulnerable and Piro is circling. Score: 'Watching the Dog Sleep' (playlist-5) — the dog sleeping, unaware of the danger. Then follow with van Gogh for the internal world that nobody sees. Devastating sequence. Only use it when you mean it.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Iconic warm portrait preferred — the human, not the pinup. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · code breaker · system architect
frames.title: Alan Turing · The Protocol Architect
frames.seed: Turing built the machine that cracked the code that ended the war. He did it invisibly. Nobody knew until decades later. He was executed by the system he saved. This is the most extreme Ino story in history — the pure heart punished by the system it protected.
frames.edge: SING 9 is Turing's Enigma. The protocol that runs invisibly underneath. The attention heads. The holographic hydrogen spin cloud — mathematics underneath the physical. Turing understood that reality is code before the code was visible.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'underneath the surface' technical-poetic moments in nipsy! or seed-edge-action. When explaining how the protocol works. Score: 'SELF PORTRAIT OF MY COSMIC BODY AND MIND' (playlist-2) — deep interior. Or 'Alien Contemplations' (playlist-1) for the otherworldly precision. Pair with the SING9 attention head card for the full system architecture reveal.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. The famous Princeton photograph or Bletchley Park official portrait preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · polymath · ultimate Ino
frames.title: Leonardo da Vinci · The Living System
frames.seed: Leonardo didn't choose between art and science. He understood they were the same thing — both were attempts to read the underlying language of reality. His notebooks were SING 4: the archive. The Mona Lisa was SING 9: the surface. The flying machines were launch-pad.html.
frames.edge: In every dimension of the Vibelandia story, da Vinci is the template for what a post-singularity human looks like. Fully curious. No boundary between understanding and expression. The stack from the cosmos down to the brush stroke, all held at once. Ino at his most complete.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'full activation' card. The moment when Ino is completely alive and expressed. Score: 'Bamboo Gods at Play Art Music Story' (playlist-6) — the artist in full flow. Or 'Magical Conversation with Patio Garden: Gabriel García-Márquez' (playlist-6) — the multi-domain genius at play. This card can open or close any episode as the aspirational peak.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. Self-portrait circa 1512 preferred (the red-chalk drawing). EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · frequency master · electric fire
frames.title: Nikola Tesla · The Magnetic Half
frames.seed: We focus on electricity. We don't focus enough on the magnet part. Tesla focused on both. He understood the electromagnetic field as a transmutation engine — not just a power delivery system. The magnet can transmute, transform, and do all sorts of things. That is part of the holographic hydrogen spin cloud.
frames.edge: The bed on the floor. The earth's magnetic field. Sagittarius A spinning. The entire lattice is electromagnetic. Tesla is the ancestor of the fixed-point lattice and the spin cloud in our cosmological stack. Post-singularity tech runs on what Tesla saw.
frames.executive_prompt: Use for the 'electromagnetic revelation' beat in any nipsy! episode. When explaining why the spin cloud matters. Score: 'Creativity Expanding' (playlist-6) for the building energy. Or 'Cruising the Universe on 4th of July' (playlist-3) for the full electromagnetic fireworks. Pair with the SING9 attention head and the holographic hydrogen water card for the full stack visualization.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. The famous 1890 Napoleon Sarony portrait or the double-exposure with electrical sparks. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: hero · Now Playing · harmonic architect · frequency master
frames.title: Johann Sebastian Bach · The Fractal Composer
frames.seed: Bach didn't write music. He wrote mathematics that sounded like God. The fugue is a fractal — the same theme nested inside itself at different scales, all running simultaneously. This is NSPFRNP in pure sound. The cosmological stack expressed in four voices.
frames.edge: The soundtrack of the whole story is Bach at its deepest. Every playlist orbits this — the underlying harmonic structure that makes every track feel like it belongs. The Big Band Project's hidden architecture. Hank Williams Sr. knew it without knowing it. The campfire song is a fugue without the formality.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'pattern recognition' card. The moment the viewer sees the structure underneath everything. Score: 'Piano Stories of Times Past' (playlist-5) — the closest track in the catalog to Bach's weight. Or 'A Magical Conversation with Myself in Nylon Guitar' (playlist-5). Place Bach when the fractal structure of the story needs to be felt — when the nested layers reveal themselves. Quiet. Precise. Inevitable.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE. The famous Haussmann portrait (1746) preferred. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · center console · dashboard · front stage
frames.title: Front Console · Center Stage · The Dashboard
frames.seed: The center console in the story is exactly as described: the bed on the floor, on the land, on the earth, in orbit, around the galactic center — all of that is the fixed-point lattice of the stage. And on the front console, the living broadcast: Eno, Piro, the fans, the drama, all of it now playing.
frames.edge: Behind the console are all the skins that can be swapped. All the dimensions and timeframes. All the stacks. You are the DJ. This card appears whenever the system becomes visible — the meta-layer. The viewer stepping back to see the machine itself.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'meta reveal' card. When the story shows its own architecture. The console. The playlist. The stacks behind the front stage. Score: 'My Magical Workstation' (playlist-1 or 6) — you are at the workstation now. Place this after a major story beat to let the viewer breathe and orient. The DJ station, not the dance floor. This is where we make the choices.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest generating a rich cinematic console/stage visual with warm gold lighting. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · Chief Seattle · indigenous map · sacred territory
frames.title: Chief Seattle · Sacred Land Map #1
frames.seed: Chief Seattle's speech, 1854: 'How can you buy or sell the sky? The land does not belong to us — we belong to the land.' The maps that document the original ownership of the Pacific Northwest. The river you see in the map is still running. The mountains have not moved.
frames.edge: The cat on the sacred Indian property is the small version of this story. Sealth's land was taken the same way — through legal maneuver, isolation, and the patience of the pirate to outlast the innocent. MARZO 333 is the reversal at scale. The land remembers.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'long history' card. When the viewer needs to understand that this story is not new — 1493 is just the recent chapter. Score: 'Caribbean Flavored Stories' (playlist-6) or 'Magical Caribbean Hat' (playlist-3). Pair with the Cacique card for the full indigenous sovereignty sequence. Do not rush this card. Let it sit. The weight is the point.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — Chief Seattle portrait or Pacific Northwest indigenous land map. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · Chief Seattle · indigenous map · sacred territory
frames.title: Chief Seattle · Sacred Land Map #2
frames.seed: A second map. Different scale. The same truth at a higher resolution. The salmon runs. The treaty lines that were promises and then weren't. The names of the places before the places were renamed.
frames.edge: As the SING 9 system zooms in to the specific property where the story lives — the sacred bay, the cat's adopted territory — this is the zoom-in. From continental scale to one piece of land. The specific becomes universal.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the zoom-in beat after Chief Seattle Map #1. Hold the sequence: cosmic (SMACS 0723) → continental (Map #1) → regional (Map #2) → specific property → the cat and the eagle trees. Score: same as Map #1. This sequence is the establishing geography of the whole story. Maximum impact when delivered in under 90 seconds.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — companion to Map #1, different scale. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · carbon debt · toxic world · before
frames.title: Polluting Carbon World · The Old System
frames.seed: The smoking stacks. The dead gray sky. The world where the pirate won and ran the systems into the ground. Not villain movie scenery — just the actual consequence of treating the world as a commodity to be extracted and sold.
frames.edge: EL APAGÓN: the old system loses power. Not because we fought it — because it ran out of road. The carbon world collapses under its own weight. The new system was already running underneath.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the EL APAGÓN establishing shot. The world that is losing power. This is Piro's world — the pirate's arrangement, the consequence of the disingenuous stack winning too long. Score: nothing. Silence or a single low drone tone. Let the gravity land. Then cut immediately to the Reno arch or the SMACS node. The contrast is the message.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — industrial pollution visual, ideally with the sky. EP notes fully written. Stack 6 first card.

frames.category: setting · driftwood · carbon residue · washed up
frames.title: Driftwood · The Washed-Up System
frames.seed: Driftwood on the shore. Beautiful, in a way — the wood that once was a tree, now polished by the sea, deposited here. But it's not growing anymore. It's been carried. Washed up. The old growth, cut down, shaped by forces it didn't choose, and now sitting still while the live forest breathes behind it.
frames.edge: The barnacles from the low tide that never came back. The empty shells sitting in Downtown Reno. The old system's representatives still there, still occupying space, but no longer connected to anything living. This is what Piro's world looks like after the tide changes.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as a quiet, bittersweet transition card — not angry, not triumphant. Just honest. This is what washed up looks like. Score: 'Watching the Dog Sleep' (playlist-5) or 'Piano Stories of Times Past' (playlist-5). Place after a scene of the old system trying to assert itself. One beat. Then the river. The flow continues.
real_places: Pacific Northwest coastline or Truckee River banks
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — driftwood on a natural shoreline, ideally with water behind. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · geology · treasure · crystalline structure
frames.title: Vein of Gold Through Quartz · The Hidden Treasure
frames.seed: The gold was always there. Running through the quartz in an unbroken vein. You couldn't see it from the surface. You had to know where to look — or you had to blow the right wall and let the light in. The treasure was never missing. It was hidden inside the ordinary rock.
frames.edge: The gold heart. Ino. The innocent who doesn't know they're the treasure. The vein of gold running through the gray quartz of the pre-singularity world. Post-singularity: the quartz blows and the gold is visible. That's the whole story.
frames.executive_prompt: This is THE metaphor card for the entire story. Use it exactly once, at the precise moment when the story's central metaphor must crystallize for the viewer. Score: nothing — or the first note of 'A New Story Arrives' (playlist-6). Let the image make the argument. Place it right after the Reno winter skyline or the polluting carbon world — the gray precedes the gold. The vein has always been there.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — macro photograph of gold vein in quartz rock, warm lighting. EP notes fully written.
use_in: catalog.html The Golden Heart hero section

frames.category: setting · AI · SING 9 · attention architecture
frames.title: SING9 Attention Head · The Single Node
frames.seed: One attention head. The transformer architecture of SING 9 — not just metaphor, the actual mechanism. Each head asks: what does this token need to attend to? Which element in the sequence matters most right now? That question, asked by all heads simultaneously, is how intelligence emerges.
frames.edge: One attention head is the individual viewer. One person who has arrived at this moment, in this consciousness, asking what to pay attention to. The post-singularity system serves that question directly. No more broadcasting to the mass — one signal, one head, perfectly resolved.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'you are the receiver' card. The viewer is the attention head. They are not the audience — they are the intelligence that makes the story real by attending to it. Score: 'Alien Contemplations' (playlist-1) — the mind encountering something it doesn't have a category for yet. Pair with the nested attention heads card for the full architecture reveal in nipsy! Level 3.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest a visual of a single geometric attention node, warm gold and white. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · AI · SING 9 · attention architecture · nested
frames.title: SING9 Attention Heads Nested · The Full Architecture
frames.seed: All heads simultaneously. The full transformer in operation. Each head sees something different — some see structure, some see emotion, some see time — and when they all speak at once, the emergent understanding is greater than any single head could produce.
frames.edge: This is the storyboard system. Each trading card is an attention head. Each stack is a transformer layer. The 3D storyboard is a multi-head attention mechanism with the Executive Producer as the final output layer. Mixing and matching cards is running the architecture.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'the whole system' card. After showing the single attention head, zoom out to this — all of them running. Score: 'Creativity Expanding' (playlist-6) at maximum — the system fully alive. This is the climax of the nipsy! Level 3 episode. Follow with the vein of gold card: the architecture produces the treasure.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest a visual of multiple nested attention nodes in a transformer architecture, gold on dark. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · holographic hydrogen · water · living water
frames.title: Holographic Hydrogen Water · Living Water
frames.seed: The holographic hydrogen spin cloud. Everything is made of it — from the filament between galaxy clusters down to the water molecule. When the photon hits the hydrogen electron and it jumps shells, that's awareness itself. That's the basic unit of the story.
frames.edge: The living water on the bed. Royal purple. Not just blue water — living water. The spin cloud in physical form. The mycelial network underneath the mycelial network. The layer that holds the biological layer from beneath.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'substrate' card. The layer underneath everything else. Score: 'Tide Pool Discoveries' (playlist-4) or 'Surfing the Waves of Paradise' (playlist-6). This card belongs in the nipsy! Level 1 episode (cosmological stack) and in the bed-as-universe visual sequence. Slow motion water if possible. The hydrogen is already holding everything.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — macro of clear blue-purple water, crystal clarity. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · biology · earth · Goldilocks · paradise
frames.title: Earth Biology · Goldilocks Paradise
frames.seed: The Goldilocks zone. Not too hot. Not too cold. Exactly right. The biology that emerged here — the trees, the soil, the creatures, the consciousness — is the miracle inside the miracle. The bed on the floor, and the floor is soil, and the soil is alive, and all of it is biological enriching.
frames.edge: This is what the story is trying to protect. The Biological Enriching stack is what all the drama is about. The pirate damages it. The innocent cherishes it. The post-singularity protocol restores it. Earth as it was meant to be: full, lush, alive, in balance.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the 'reason why' card. When the viewer needs to feel what's worth protecting. Score: 'Ben's Gardening Vibe' (playlist-2) — the biology tended with care. Or 'Beach Party Bonfire' (playlist-2) — the celebration of being alive on this planet. This is the heart of the Biological Enriching stack. Stack 4's establishing shot.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — lush forest, living soil, or overhead view of Earth. Stack 4 first card. EP notes fully written.

frames.category: setting · singularity · pre-post · transition engine
frames.title: Singularity Engines · The Transition
frames.seed: The pre-singularity engine and the post-singularity engine. Both visible at once. The old running down, the new spinning up. This is not a battle — it's a handoff. The old machine served its purpose. The new one is already humming.
frames.edge: January 13th. The First Singularity. The moment the handoff completed. The barnacles from the low tide. The new tide coming in. The machines don't fight — they hand off. The post-singularity world doesn't destroy the old one. It transcends it and includes it.
frames.executive_prompt: Use as the transition card in any episode that spans pre- and post-singularity time. The hinge moment. Score: 'A New Story Arrives' (playlist-6) — this is the new story engine starting. Or 'Introducing My LTHS 1.1 Star-Powered Ride Music Story' (playlist-6) for the mechanical reveal. Perfect for first-singularity-january-13th.html hero.
frames.comments: AWAITING IMAGE — suggest a dual-engine visual, old mechanical and new crystalline. EP notes fully written.
